full_bibliographic_entry: '''Stefan Zweig, 1881-1942. Centenary Symposium''' [10 December 1981]. This symposium was held at the Institute of Germanic Studies, 29 Russell Square, London WC18 5DP, under the auspices of the Institute of Germanic Studies and the Austrian Institut
publisher: Richard Strauss und Stefan Zweig - Zur Problemlosigkeit einer künstlerischen Zusammenarbeit
clean_content:
'''Stefan Zweig, 1881-1942. Centenary Symposium''' [10 December 1981]. This symposium was held at the Institute of Germanic Studies, 29 Russell Square, London WC18 5DP, under the auspices of the Institute of Germanic Studies and the Austrian Institute

'''Session 1''' [Chairman: Professor Sir Ernst Gombrich]

Otto Kolleritsch [Hochschule für Musik, Graz]: "Richard Strauss und Stefan Zweig - Zur Problemlosigkeit einer künstlerischen Zusammenarbeit"


'''Session 2''' [Chairman: Professor J. P. Stern. Honorary Director, Institute of Germanic Studies, University of London]

J. D. A. Warren [Oxford Polytechnic]: "Stefan Zweig, Jeremias and the Anti-War Drama of the First World War"
David Turner [University of Hull]: "Imagery and the Image of Man in Stefan Zweig's Novellen"
Sylvia M. Patsch [Universität Innsbruck]: "Stefan Zweig und Ben Jonson"

full_bibliographic_entry: '''Stefan Zweig Symposium''' [24-25 November 1981]. This symposium was held at the Palais Pálffy, Wien I, Josefsplatz 6. It was organized by the Austrian Society for Literature [Österreichische Gesellschaft für Literatur] on behalf of the Cultural Of
publisher: Stefan Zweig und die Neue Welt
clean_content:
'''Stefan Zweig Symposium''' [24-25 November 1981]. This symposium was held at the Palais Pálffy, Wien I, Josefsplatz 6. It was organized by the Austrian Society for Literature [Österreichische Gesellschaft für Literatur] on behalf of the Cultural Office of the City of Vienna [Kulturamt der Stadt Wien]

'''Lectures:''' 


Donald A. Prater [Genf]: "Stefan Zweig und die Neue Welt"
György Vajda [Budapest]: "Stefan Zweig - aktueller Chronist einer vergangenen Welt"
Klaus Heydemann [Wien]: "Das Beispiel des Erasmus - Stefan Zweigs Einstellung zur Politik"
Wolfgang Greissenegger [Wien]: "Stefan Zweig als Dramatiker und Beobachter des Theaters seiner Zeit"
Klaus Zelewitz [Salzburg]: "Geschichte erzählen - ein Risiko? Die Biographien Stefan Zweigs"
Otto Kolleritsch [Graz]: "Richard Strauss und Stefan Zweig"
Joseph Strelka [New York]: "Psychoanalytische Ideen in Zweigs Novellen"


'''Reading:''' 

Norbert Kappen liest aus ''Die Welt von Gestern''

title: '''The Stefan Zweig Centenary Conference'''
full_bibliographic_entry: '''The Stefan Zweig Centenary Conference''' [28 November 1981]. This conference was held at the Hunter Museum of Art, Bluff View/Chattanooga, Tennessee. It was sponsored by the Southeastern Stefan Zweig Committee: Raymond E. Barrick, chairman, and me
clean_content:
'''The Stefan Zweig Centenary Conference''' [28 November 1981]. This conference was held at the Hunter Museum of Art, Bluff View/Chattanooga, Tennessee. It was sponsored by the Southeastern Stefan Zweig Committee: Raymond E. Barrick, chairman, and members Pierrette-Monique Denzler, Richard Firda, Renate Hufft, Sanford Shaw, and Reinhard K. Zachau

'''Lectures:'''

Marion Sonnenfeld [State University of New York, Fredonia, NY]: "Chessnovella"
Reinhard K. Zachau [University of the South, Sewanee, TN]: "Stefan Zweig's Political Consciousness in the Emigration"
Raymond E. Barrick [Lee College, Baytown, TX]: "The Sanctity of the Inner Man in the Works of Stefan Zweig"
Ilsedore B. Jonas [Carnegie-Mellon University, Pittsburgh, PA]: "Stefan Zweig und Rainer Maria Rilke"
Egbert Krispyn [University of Georgia, Athens, GA]: "Some Observations on Stefan Zweig's Poetry"
Richard Firda [Georgia State University, Atlanta, GA]: "Vita - Zweig's Welt von Gestern"
August J. DeBerdt [Berry College, Rome, GA]: "Stefan Zweig - The Art of Poetic Translation"
Thomas Thornton [University of California, Santa Barbara, CA]: "Chaos in und zwischen den Zeilen - Eine Betrachtung von Rilkes ''Die Näherin'' und Stefan Zweigs ''Leporella''"
Peter J. Macris [State University of New York, Oneonta, NY]: "Ben Jonson and Stefan Zweig - The Chemistry Was Right"


'''Concert program:'''

The evening concert program was presented by Phillip Thomas [pianist], and Jimmy W. Burns [baritone]

title: '''Stefan-Zweig-Ausstellung - Für ein Europa des Geistes'''
full_bibliographic_entry: '''Stefan-Zweig-Ausstellung - Für ein Europa des Geistes''' [19 February-26 April 1992]. This exhibition was sponsored by the city of Salzburg and organized by Klemens Renoldner and Hildemar Holl. Layout and graphics by Peter Karlhuber ["Die Ausstell
publisher: '''Stefan-Zweig-Ausstellung - Für ein Europa des Geistes''' [19 February-26 April
clean_content:
'''Stefan-Zweig-Ausstellung - Für ein Europa des Geistes''' [19 February-26 April 1992]. This exhibition was sponsored by the city of Salzburg and organized by Klemens Renoldner and Hildemar Holl. Layout and graphics by Peter Karlhuber ["Die Ausstellung `Stefan Zweig - Für ein Europa des Geistes' anläßlich der 50. Wiederkehr des Todestages von Stefan Zweig folgt zwei Struktur-Mustern. Als durchgehender Faden leitet die Biographie des Dichters den Besucher wie eine Führung durch die Ausstellungsräume. Parallel und ergänzend dazu werden einzelne thematische Schwerpunkte <nowiki>gesetzt und zeitgeschichtliche Bezüge hergestellt. . . "]. The exhibition contained some 140 pictures and other Zweig memorabilia
</nowiki>
For a description of the exhibition catalog see Stefan Zweig. Für ein Europa des Geistes. Ausstellung der Stadt Salzburg 1992. 

For a seven-page description of this exhibition, which was converted into a Touring Exhibition under the title "Stefan Zweig - Ein Österreicher aus Europa (Wanderausstellung)", contact Dr. Alois Haslinger, Kulturamt der Stadt Salzburg, Postfach 63, Mozartplatz 5, A-5024 Salzburg


Ausstellungsteil I: Acht Würfel-Vitrinen, V1-V8 (50 x 50 cm, Höhe 120 cm). Drei Lesepulte, P1-P3 (Maße ca. wie Würfel-Vitrinen). Acht Plexiglastafeln, T1-T8 (224 x 50 cm). Sechzehn Porträts, B1-B16 (41 x 31 cm)

Ausstellungsteil II: Drei Ausstellungskojen, A, B, C (270 x 270 cm, Höhe 230 cm). Koje A: Wien/Zürich 1881-1918. Koje B: Salzburg 1919-1934. Koje C: London/Petropolis 1934-1942

Technische Daten

Kosten für den Aussteller

Begleitbuch: Klemens Renoldner, Peter Karlhuber, Hildemar Holl. Stefan Zweig - Texte, Bilder, Dokumente. Salzburg: Residenz-Verlag, 1993

title: '''Stefan Zweig, Leben und Werk'''
full_bibliographic_entry: '''Stefan Zweig, Leben und Werk''' [30 November 1994-3 February 1995]. This exhibition, organized by Volker Michels, was held at the Literaturhaus Magdeburg. See: ''Stefan Zweig 1881-1942'', an eight-page prospectus to the exhibition published by the
publisher:
the Landeshauptstadt Magdeburg, Kulturamt 

'''Contains:'''
<lst type=bracket start=1>
Four photographs [Zweig, 26 August 1936, inscribed to Jaques Chermont; Zweig in Ossining, NY, summer 1941; Lotte Zweig 1937/38; Zweig as a student 1902]
Facsimiles of Zweig's signet, his Ex Libris and the pen-drawing of Zweig by B[enedikt] F[red] Dolbin
A three-page biographical listing of his life and works and an excerpt from Volker Michels's essay "Stefan Zweig, ein Humanist im Kreuzfeuer der Ideologien"
clean_content:
'''Stefan Zweig, Leben und Werk''' [30 November 1994-3 February 1995]. This exhibition, organized by Volker Michels, was held at the Literaturhaus Magdeburg. See: ''Stefan Zweig 1881-1942'', an eight-page prospectus to the exhibition published by the Landeshauptstadt Magdeburg, Kulturamt 

'''Contains:'''

Four photographs [Zweig, 26 August 1936, inscribed to Jaques Chermont; Zweig in Ossining, NY, summer 1941; Lotte Zweig 1937/38; Zweig as a student 1902]
Facsimiles of Zweig's signet, his Ex Libris and the pen-drawing of Zweig by B[enedikt] F[red] Dolbin
A three-page biographical listing of his life and works and an excerpt from Volker Michels's essay "Stefan Zweig, ein Humanist im Kreuzfeuer der Ideologien". See: Stefan Zweig: Leben und Werk im Bild [1981], No. 10, pp. 330-351


In conjunction with the exhibition there were also

A reading on 8 December 1994 entitled "Bahnsteig Europa. Eine Zeitreise 50 (52) Jahre nach dem Tod von Stefan Zweig". The text was read by Ernst Jani, Ortheater [Laufen]
Two films were also presented as part of the exhibition: ''Schachnovelle'' [Roxy Film, 1960, with Curd Jürgens] on 15 and 16 December, 1994, and ''Brennendes Geheimnis'' [Vestron Pictures, 1989, with Klaus Maria Brandauer] on 26 and 27 January 1995

publisher: Stefan Zweig - Für ein Europa des Geistes. In vier Ausstellungskuben präsentiert die Stadt Salzburg den bedeutenden österreichischen Schriftsteller Stefan Zweig. Neben der biografischen Chronologie in Bildern und Dokumenten werden die wichtigsten Lebensstationen Zweigs - Wien, Salzburg, London, Brasilien - dargestellt. full_bibliographic_entry:
'''Die Welt von Gestern - Stefan Zweig 1881-1942 - Leben und Werk eines Europäers''' An exhibition [touring exhibition] in the in Strauhof , 10 April to 19 May 1996

'''Format of the exhibition:'''

Einladung zur Eröffnung der Ausstellung. Im Rah
publisher: Einblick in die Ausstellung im Zürcher Strauhof
clean_content:
'''Die Welt von Gestern - Stefan Zweig 1881-1942 - Leben und Werk eines Europäers''' An exhibition [touring exhibition] in the in Strauhof , 10 April to 19 May 1996

'''Format of the exhibition:'''

Einladung zur Eröffnung der Ausstellung. Im Rahmen der Ausstellung werden erstmals bedeutende Dokumente der Autographen Sammlung Stefan Zweigs aus dem Besitze der Fondation Martin Bodmer gezeigt im Stadthaus Zürich, 9. April 1996
Begrüßung: Stadtpräsident Josef Estermann und Bürgermeister Josef Dechant, Salzburg
Zur Ausstellung: Donald A. Prater
Zum Wirken des Sammlers Martin Bodmer: Werner Weber
Senta Berger liest ausgewählte Texte von Stefan Zweig
Anschließend Besichtigung der Ausstellung im Strauhof


'''Concerning this exhibition see the following''':

Martin Bircher [Editor]. Stefan Zweigs Welt der Autographen [LA1 12]

Benedikt Scherer. "Unterschätzter Kämpfer für eine europäische Kultur" in ''Tages-Anzeiger'' [Zürich], 11 April 1996, Kultur, p. 83 Contains 1 photograph: "Einblick in die Ausstellung im Zürcher Strauhof"

"Die Welt von Gestern" in ''Tagblatt der Stadt Zürich'' [Zürich], 16 April 1996

"`Zuckende, heisse Urschrift' - Sammler Stefan Zweig im `Strauhof'" in ''Neue Zürcher Zeitung'' [Zürich], 11 April 1996 (No. 84), p. 54. Contains 2 photographs: "Ausschnitt aus einer 79seitigen Hochzeitspredigt von Johann Caspar Lavater aus dem Jahr 1777, die zur Autographen-Sammlung Stefan Zweigs gehörte" and "Stefan Zweig 1916". Also contains a printed version of Zweig's autobiographical sketch sent to the Lesezirkel Hottingen in 1917. The original manuscript is on display in the exhibition]

Donald A. Prater. "Einführende Worte Zweig-Ausstellung Zürich 9.4.1996". A 4-page typescript

Panchkula 2016) by Oma Sharma [Omā Åšarmā], the acclaimed Hindi translator of Stefan Zweig's "Die Welt von Gestern. Erinnerungen eines Europäers" ["Vo guzarā zamānā", Panchkula 2012]. clean_content:
'''"Ich gehöre nirgends mehr hin!" Stefan Zweigs Schachnovelle - Eine Geschichte aus dem Exil''' [3 March - 28 May 2017]. This exhibition, organized and directed by Klemens Renoldner and Peter Karlhuber, was sponsored by the Stefan Zweig Centre Salzburg and held in the Salzburg Museum | Neue Residenz, Mozartplatz 1, 5010 Salzburg. The exhibition was accompanied by a volume entitled ''"Ich gehöre nirgends mehr hin!" Stefan Zweigs Schachnovelle - Eine Geschichte aus dem Exil''. Edited by Klemens Renoldner and Peter Karlhuber. clean_content:
'''[2014]: Casa Stefan Zweig - Memória Brasil, Rio de Janeiro'''

''A Network of Friends: Stefan Zweig - His Last Address Book 1940-1942''. Introduction by Alberto Dines. Organization of the volume by Israel Beloch. Research and texts by Alberto Dines, Kristina Michahelles and Israel Beloch. English translation by Hugo Moss. Graphic Design by Victor Burton. 197/(3)p. Beautifully illustrated

'''Contents:'''

Introduction [Alberto Dines], pp. 7-13
Thoughts about Stefan Zweig's last Address Book [Klemens Renoldner], pp. 15-23
Stefan Zweig: a biography, pp. 25-27
Facsimile of the Address Book, pp. 29-(82) [Size:13 x 11,5 cm. (Reproduced here in actual size). Binding in leather. Spiral finishing. 50 pages. Filled from June 1940 to February 1942. Probably printed in the United States]
Biographies of the characters, pp. (83)-193
Sources, pp. 194-197

clean_content:
'''[2010]: MawqiÊ¿ wa-Muntadayāt Kafr al-Zayyāt, Kafr al-Zayyāt [Kafr el Zayat, Egypt]'''

"Al-Adīb al-nimsāwī Stīfān Zfāyj" [The Austrian Man of Letters Stefan Zweig] in ''MawqiÊ¿ wa-Muntadayāt Kafr al-Zayyāt'' [Homepage and Forum of Kafr el Zayat], Kafr el Zayat, 21 November 2010. Abū Yaḥyā is a pseudonym. Author's name unknown 

Published online:

http://kafrelzayat.hooxs.com/t714-topic

This is a review of ''Junūn al-ḥubb'' [Love's Madness], comprising the Arabic translations "24 [ArbaÊ¿ wa-Ê¿ishrūn] sāÊ¿ah fī ḥayāt imraÊ¾ah" and "Junūn al-ḥubb" of Stefan Zweig's two novellas "Vierundzwanzig Stunden aus dem Leben einer Frau" and "Brennendes Geheimnis". The reviewer and administrator of the web forum "MawqiÊ¿ wa-Muntadayāt Kafr al-Zayyāt" [Homepage and Forum of Kafr el Zayat] displays, in the way he decorates the webpage (as accessed on 29 September 2017), open hostility towards Israel and unbridled admiration for Hitler and his attempt to annihilate the Jews, while he seems, in the text of his very positive review, not even aware of Stefan Zweig's Jewish identity and the true reasons for his exile in Brazil. Due to the criticism directed here against "Abū Yaḥyā"'s overt admiration for Hitler's genocide, the administrator of the web forum has meanwhile modified the display of his review [as of 12 October 2017] and removed Hitler's infamous dictum justifying the extinction of the Jewish people.

See: Junūn al-ḥubb [Love's Madness]. Edited by Maḥmūd Qāsim. Translator not indicated. 214p. Cairo: Dār al-Hilāl, 2010

clean_content:
'''[1989]: Theater der Landeshauptstadt Mainz'''

''Adam Lux'' [Stefan Zweig's drama ''Adam Lux. Zehn Bilder aus dem Leben eines deutschen Revolutionärs'']. See: Adam Lux / Volume [2003]


Knut Beck. "Nachwort" in ''Das Lamm des Armen. Dramen'' [Edited with an afterword by Knut Beck. Frankfurt am Main: S. Fischer Verlag], p. 418: "'Das Lamm des Armen' war das letzte eigene Drama, das Stefan Zweig 1929 zur Aufführuung freigab. In seinem Nachlaß fanden sich noch "Zehn Bilder aus dem Leben eines deutschen Revolutionärs - Adam Lux" - eine Rohfassung, die er nicht mehr zur Bühnenreife gebracht hat"
Premiere performance: 21 January 1989 in the Theater der Landeshauptstadt Mainz. The play was updated on 30 November 2012
Director: Guy Reinesch
Cast: Oliver Nitsche and Clemens Kuntzsch
See: ''Mainzer Theaterhefte'' [Mainz], No. 7 [Spielzeit 1988/89 / Uraufführung 'Adam Lux' ]. (26)p. Illustrated. Contributions by Knut Beck, Nino Erné, Annelen Hasselwander et al. The program brochure also contains letters from Romain Rolland to Stefan Zweig and Stefan Zweig to Romain Rolland, Hermann Bahr and Arthur Schnitzler, 26 December 1912-7 March 1929, all pertaining to ''Adam Lux''
See also: Benedikt Erenz. "Das Labyrinth der Freiheit. Eine Entdeckung, keine Sternstunde: Stefan Zweigs Revolutionsdrama 'Adam Lux'" in ''Zeit Online'' [Printed first in ''Die Zeit'' [Hamburg], No. 5 [1989]. Online: http://www.zeit.de/1989/05/das-labyrinth-der-freiheit/komplettansicht
On 4 November 2016 excerpts from the play were read by Andreas Toschka and Marion Mück-Raab in the Offenes Wohnzimmer, Kostheim-Mainz

The Libyan-French journalist and researcher Souad Wheidi (she seems to be an Uyghur and Wolga-Tatar specialist) compares the political situation in post-revolutionary Libya to the historical setting Stefan Zweig had described in his ''Castellio gegen Calvin oder Ein Gewissen gegen die Gewalt'' [Arabic.: ''Ê¿Unf al-diktātūriyyah'']. Thus, the article presupposes the familiarity with the Arabic translation "Ê¿Unf al-diktātūriyyah" of Zweig's book

publisher: "Bayna Almāniyā al-ams wa-Miṣr al-yawm" [Between the Germany of Yesterday and the Egypt of Today] in ''Al-Miṣrī al-yawm'' [Al-Masry Al-Youm / The Egyptian Today] [Cairo]
clean_content:
"Bayna Almāniyā al-ams wa-Miṣr al-yawm" [Between the Germany of Yesterday and the Egypt of Today] in ''Al-Miṣrī al-yawm'' [Al-Masry Al-Youm / The Egyptian Today] [Cairo], No. 1896 [22 August 2009], pp. ?? 

The Egyptian journalist compares the catastrophe brought on Germany by political irrationalism in the first half of the twentieth century with a similar irrationalism as propagated by political Islam in Egypt and the Arab world at large. He takes his starting point from Stefan Zweig's autobiography "Die Welt von Gestern. Erinnerungen eines Europäers", where Zweig describes the tragic consequences of the political fanaticism of his own times. Although the author does not specify the edition of Zweig's biography he relies on, it is probably one of the two Arabic translations thereof

Published online:

http://today.almasryalyoum.com/article2.aspx?ArticleID=223319&IssueID=1505

title:
1 page, undated handwritten text, with Zweig's signature. In the Schiller-Nationalmuseum und Deutsches Literaturarchiv, Marbach am Neckar, A: Gregor-Dellin, Mss. Anderer

"Unsere Generation war aufgewachsen in dem unbeugsamen-glühenden Glauben an die europäische Mission. Wir meinten, dass Europa als kostbarstes Gut und sicherste Bürgschaft seiner alten Civilisation den Frieden der Welt zu wahren hätte, den Fortschritt zu fördern und Führerin zu einer neuen Form der Humanität zu sein. Wenn nun Europa dieser seiner heiligsten Aufgabe so kläglich untreu geworden ist, wenn es in sinnloser Selbstzerfleischung sich zerstört und in einzelnen Ländern die moralische Unbedenklichkeit zur These, die Brutalität zum Dogma erhebt, so werden wir unserem Glauben darum nicht untreu und wenden unser unverbrüchliches Vertrauen der Jugend in den jüngeren Ländern - vor allem America - eintgegen: an ihnen ist es, die Freiheit des Geistes, die Humanität des Herzens für die Welt zu retten!"

full_bibliographic_entry: Comments from Stefan Zweig to Elisabeth Bergner. London, after 1934. See the following auction catalog: Galerie Gerda Bassenge, Berlin. Auktion 56, 14. - 16. Nov(ember) 1990, Nummer 3059: "Zweig, Stefan, Schriftsteller (1881-1942). Typoskript einer F
publisher: Zweig, Stefan, Schriftsteller (1881-1942). Typoskript einer Film-Story mit einigen Korrekturen, einem Begleitschreiben und einem Namenszug nebst Adresse auf dem Einband. 243 (recte:259) gezahlte maschinegeschriebene Blätter, einseitig beschrieben; 1 Blatt eigenhändiges Begleitscheiben (1 Seite). Größe 4to. Geheftet in einem Aktendeckel. (London nach 1934). Das deutschsprachige Typoskript des als Drehbuch-Vorlage gedachten Romans mit dem englischen Titel
clean_content: Comments from Stefan Zweig to Elisabeth Bergner. London, after 1934. See the following auction catalog: Galerie Gerda Bassenge, Berlin. Auktion 56, 14. - 16. Nov(ember) 1990, Nummer 3059: "Zweig, Stefan, Schriftsteller (1881-1942). Typoskript einer Film-Story mit einigen Korrekturen, einem Begleitschreiben und einem Namenszug nebst Adresse auf dem Einband. 243 (recte:259) gezahlte maschinegeschriebene Blätter, einseitig beschrieben; 1 Blatt eigenhändiges Begleitscheiben (1 Seite). Größe 4to. Geheftet in einem Aktendeckel. (London nach 1934). Das deutschsprachige Typoskript des als Drehbuch-Vorlage gedachten Romans mit dem englischen Titel "Beware of Pity" war für die ebenso wie Zweig nach London emigrierte Schauspielerin Elisabeth Bergner bestimmt, wie aus dem Begleitschreiben "Anmerkungen für Elis. B." hervorgeht. Da heißt es unter anderem: Ihre "Rolle' beginnt Seite 18, dann 100, dann von Seite 260 in continuo bis Schluss... Der Schluss wird für einen Film völlig anders gestaltet, sehr eindringlich und wirksam. Ist mir innerlich ganz klar..." Der Text beginnt mit dem Satz: "...Die ganze Sache begann mit einer Ungeschicklichkeit, einer völlig unverschuldeten Tölpelei, einer 'Gaffe' , wie die Franzosen sagen". Der Roman endet abrupt mit Seite 243, und es ist uns nicht bekannt, ob er fortgesetzt wurde. Auf Seiten 2-67 finden sich viele Verbesserungen von der Hand Zweigs, dann nur noch sporadisch. Der Aktendeckel trägt außen Stefan Zweigs Namen und Adresse in London sowie den Vermerk: "I. Teil, letzte Fassung", ferner einen aufgeklebten Zettel mit Elisabeth Bergners Handschrift: "Stefan Zweig. Beware of Pity".

clean_content:

'''Contents:'''

Introdução: Stefan Zweig e o Brasil como um país do futuro. 65 anos depois [João Paulo dos Reis Velloso], pp. (7)-10
A invenção do paraíso no inferno do Estado Novo [Alberto Dines], pp. (11)-25

De volta para o futuro: continuidade e mudança no Brasil dos anos 1940 ao presente [Regis Bonelli], pp. (55)-90

Comentario I: promessas não cumpridas de um olhar estrangeiro [Tito Ryff], pp. (137)-144
Comentario II: Stefan Zweig e a primeira eleição totalmente digital no Brasil [Ricardo Neves], pp. (145)-149
Comentario III: o PIB crescerá mais? Quando e quanto? [Raul Velloso], pp. (151)-154


'''NB:''' "Textos apresentados e discutidos no painel I do Fórum Especial, realizado em setembro de 2006 no Rio de Janeiro, teve como tema básico 'Projeto de Brasil - opções de país e opções desenvolvimento'. Comemorativo dos 125 anos do nascimento do autor austríaco Stefan Zweig e 65 anos de edição do livro ''Brasil, um país do futuro''. Relacionado a: ''Projeto de Brasil: opções de país, opções de desenvolvimento''".

title: Bella Brodzki
original_title: Sarah Lawrence College, Yonkers, New York
full_bibliographic_entry: Bella Brodzki [Sarah Lawrence College, Yonkers, New York]. "Stefan Zweig and the Meaning of 'Europe' in the Early Twenty-First Century". A lecture at the Modern Language Association International Symposium, Friday 24 June 2016. The symposium was enti
clean_content: Bella Brodzki [Sarah Lawrence College, Yonkers, New York]. "Stefan Zweig and the Meaning of 'Europe' in the Early Twenty-First Century". A lecture at the Modern Language Association International Symposium, Friday 24 June 2016. The symposium was entitled "Other Europes: Migrations, Translations, Transformations" and was held at the Heinrich Heine Universität, Düsseldorf, 23-25 June 2016\n\n

'''Contents'''

Nota Previa, p. (7)
Introdução, pp. (9)-20
As cartas de Stefan Zweig para Armando Cortesão, pp. (21)-53. These pages contain 14 letters, 5 postcards, and 1 letter card from Zweig to Cortesão plus a copy of the Zweigs' wedding announcement [September 1939] with a few words of personal greeting by Stefan and Lotte Zweig

Bibliografia, pp. 64-66

This is a screening announcement of the German-French-Austrian movie "Vor der Morgenröte" (2016), directed by Maria Schrader, script by Maria Schrader and Jan Schomburg, and starring Josef Hader, Barbara Sukowa, and Aenne Schwarz. The film was being screened (with Thai and English subtitles) on the 24th of January 2017 at 7h30 pm in a film festival organized by the Goethe-Institut Thailand, the local branch in Bangkok of the German cultural institute.

title: Amanda Cornwall
full_bibliographic_entry: Amanda Cornwall [University of Oregon, Eugene OR]. "Mirroring Empire's Decline: Stefan Zweig's ''The World of Yesterday'' and Miklós Bánffy's Transylvanian Trilogy". A lecture at the Modern Language Association International Symposium, Friday 24 June
clean_content: Amanda Cornwall [University of Oregon, Eugene OR]. "Mirroring Empire's Decline: Stefan Zweig's ''The World of Yesterday'' and Miklós Bánffy's Transylvanian Trilogy". A lecture at the Modern Language Association International Symposium, Friday 24 June 2016. The symposium was entitled "Other Europes: Migrations, Translations, Transformations" and was held at the Heinrich Heine Universität, Düsseldorf, 23-25 June 2016. Concerning the English translation of the Bánffy trilogy see: ''The Writing on the Wall (Erdélyi Történet). The Transylvanian Trilogy''. Translated by Patrick Thursfield and Katalin Bánffy-Jelen. London: Arcadia Books / UNESCO Publishing. Book One. ''They Were Counted''. Foreword by Patrick Leigh Fermor. Introduction by Patrick Thursfield. xix/596p. [1999]. Book Two. ''They Were Found Wanting''. Foreword by Patrick Leigh Fermor. ix/470p. [2000]. Book Three. ''They Were Divided''. Foreword by Patrick Leigh Fermor. ix/326. [2001]\n\n

Translated from Brazilian Portuguese into Spanish by Ana María Pomí. The name of the author of this text is not indicated. On 29 October 1940, in Buenos Aires, Stefan Zweig repeated his lecture "The Spiritual Unity of the World" that he had given in Rio de Janeiro in August 1936. This time the text was in Spanish, translated from the German original by Alfredo Cahn.

This is a screening announcement of the American film "Letter from an Unknown Woman" (1948), directed by Max Ophüls, screenplay adaptation by Howard Koch, and starring Joan Fontaine, Louis Jourdan, Mady Christians and Marcel Journet. The film (in Arabic translation) was being screened on the 31st of October 2011 at 4:00 PM in the precinct of the "Al-Muntadā al-Tanwīrī al-Thaqāfī al-Filasṭīnī (Tanwīr)" [Enlightenment - The Palestinian Forum for Cultural Enlightenment] in Nablus.

'''[1939]: N.V. Servire, Den Haag'''

''De levende gedachten van Tolstoi'' [The Living Thoughts of Tolstoi]. Translated by Frank de Vries. 191p. [Levende gedachten, eerste reeks (Living Thoughts, First Series), No. 3]

'''Contents:'''

Stefan Zweig belicht Tolstoi [Tolstoi als religiöser und sozialer Denker], pp. (7)-37
Tolstoi's weg naar zijn innerlijk zelf [Tolstoy's Way to His Inner Self. From ''Mijn Biecht'' / ''My Confession''], pp. 40-69
Tolstoi's critiek op zijn tijd [Tolstoy's Criticism of His Age. From ''Het Koninkrijk Gods'' / ''The Kingdom of God''], pp. 70-105
Tolstoi's filosofie der geschiedenis [Tolstoy's Philosophy of History. From ''Oorlog en Vrede'' / ''War and Peace''], pp. 106-116
Tolstoi's ethische gedachte in verbeeldingsvorm [Korte vehalen] [Tolstoy's Ethical Thought in Imaginative Form / Short Stories], pp. (117)-191

::Nicolass Grootstok [Nikolai Palkin], pp. 118-128
::Drie parabels [Three Parables], pp. 129-144
::Koning Assarhadon [King Assarhadon], pp. 145-153
::Waardood de mensen leven [What Men Live By], pp. 154-191

NB:Page 38 contains the titles of the works that Stefan Zweig selected for this volume and page 39 contains a list of Tolstoy's works (1828-1910)

full_bibliographic_entry: '''[1910-1913]: Insel-Verlag, Leipzig'''\n\n''Ausgewählte Romane und Novellen''. 12 vols. Revised and edited from earlier translations by Leo Feld and Erwin Krauss. Foreword by Stefan Zweig. Illustrated by Phiz [i.e. Hablôt Knight Browne] et al. Titl
clean_content:
'''[1910-1913]: Insel-Verlag, Leipzig'''

''Ausgewählte Romane und Novellen''. 12 vols. Revised and edited from earlier translations by Leo Feld and Erwin Krauss. Foreword by Stefan Zweig. Illustrated by Phiz [i.e. Hablôt Knight Browne] et al. Title page and cover design by E. R. Weiss. Stefan Zweig's foreword "Charles Dickens", Vol. 1 [1910], pp. v-xxx. Of the 12-volume Library Edition, 200 copies were printed on cotton paper, numbered and bound in leather. The 12-volume set was not reprinted

A 6-volume edition printed on India paper was also printed. Leipzig: Insel-Verlag, 1910-1913. Stefan Zweig's foreword "Charles Dickens", Vol. 1 [1910], pp. v-xxx

Editions:

*1st edition. Vol. 1. 5,000 copies. 1910
*2nd edition. Vol. 1. 5,000 copies. 1913
*3rd edition. Vol. 1. 4,000 copies. 1921
*4th edition. Vol. 1. 4,000 copies. 1923
*5th edition. Vol. 1. 4,000 copies. 1926

full_bibliographic_entry: ''Die Insel'' [4p. Each copy also contains a photographic reprint of Stefan Zweig's original handwritten version]\n\n"Die Wiedergabe des autographen Manuskriptes von Stefan Zweig erfolgt mit freundlicher Erlaubnis des Deutschen Literaturarchivs Marba
publisher: ''Die Insel'' [4p. Each copy also contains a photographic reprint of Stefan Zweig's original handwritten version]\n\n"Die Wiedergabe des autographen Manuskriptes von Stefan Zweig erfolgt mit freundlicher Erlaubnis des Deutschen Literaturarchivs Marbach (Kippenberg-Archiv
clean_content:
''Die Insel'' [4p. Each copy also contains a photographic reprint of Stefan Zweig's original handwritten version]

"Die Wiedergabe des autographen Manuskriptes von Stefan Zweig erfolgt mit freundlicher Erlaubnis des Deutschen Literaturarchivs Marbach (Kippenberg-Archiv, Zugangsnummer 64.1893). Markus Haucke, Berlin, bei dem die Folgerechte für Marcus Behmer liegen, danken wir für die Einwilligung zum Nachdruck der Radierung. Schriftsatz in der Golden Type und Maxima: André Grau-Druck:Thomas-Druck - Bindung:Bettina Mönch, alle Leipzig. - Die Auflage beträgt 500 Exemplare, davon 400 Exemplare für die Internationale Stefan Zweig Gesellschaft in Salzburg. 100 Exemplare sind den Teilnehmern am Festlichen Jahrestreffen des Leipziger Bibliophilen Abends am 6. Dezember 2016 als Gabe von H K zugeeignet". Internationale Stefan Zweig-Gesellschaft, c/o Literaturarchiv, Universität Salzburg 

'''Contents:'''

Die Insel [Stefan Zweig], pp. I-II
Radierung [Marcus Behmer, Insel-Allegorie als Gruß für Anton Kippenberg, 1924], p. (III)
Stefan Zweigs Bericht über ein bemerkenswertes Eiland in Centraldeutschland [Oliver Matuschek], p. IV

Nur die Lebendigen schaffen die Welt [2016], No. 17, pp. 72-74

'''Contents:'''
clean_content:
'''[1904]: Egon Fleischel & Co. Verlag, Berlin'''

''Die Liebe der Erika Ewald. Novellen''. (6)/179p. Book ornamentation by Hugo Steiner-Prag. 20 copies of the first edition were printed on handmade paper and signed by the author

'''Contents:'''

Die Liebe der Erika Ewald, pp. (1)-60 [Dedication: Camill Hoffmann in inniger Freundschaft]
Der Stern über dem Walde, pp. (61)-75 [Dedication: Franz Carl Ginzky in herzlicher Gesinnung]
Die Wanderung, pp. (77)-86 [Dedication: E. M. Lilien dem Künstler und dem Freunde]
Die Wunder des Lebens, pp. (87)-179 [Dedication: Hans Müller dem lieben Freunde]


'''See:''' Stefan Zweig 1881-1942. Ausstellung in der Residenz in Salzburg 15. Juli bis 31. August 1961 [Wien, 1961], No. 24, p. 40: In a volume donated to the personal library of James Carleton Young, Stefan Zweig wrote the following: "Die vier Novellen, welche sich hier zu einem Buche vereinen, entstammen vier verschiedenen Jahren und reichen zurück bis in den Beginn meines künstlerischen Schaffens. Ein innerliches Band haben sie nicht - wenn nicht Persönlichkeit des Dichters sich gleich stark in allem zum Ausdruck bringen kann. Ich habe in der letzten (Die Wunder des Lebesn) bewußt veranschaulicht, was die ersten drei nur intuitiv gaben: daß unser Leben tiefere Ströme hat als die äußerlichen Geschehnisse, die uns zusammenführen und trennen, und daß eine tiefe Magik des Lebens, nur dem Gefühle zugänglich und nicht den Sinnen, Schicksale beherrscht, selbst dann, wenn wir sie selbst zu lenken glauben".

Nachwort, pp. 125-126
Zur Schrift "Barbou" [Eckehart SchumacherGebler], pp. 127-141 ["Freundschaftliche Hinweise von John Dreyfus und Duncan Avery ermöglichten es mir damals, die ganze Serie Antiqua, Kursiv, Kapitälchen und Mediäval-Ziffern für das Typostudio SchumacherGebler in München zu erwerben, die Schrift damit zum ersten und vermutlich einzigen Mal nach Deutschland zu bringen. Zusammen mit einer Vielzahl anderer reizvoller Monotype-Schriften befindet sie sich heute im Besitz der Offizin Haag-Drugulin. Und das vorliegende Bändchen - das zum Schluß - ist der erste Druck mit dieser Schrift hierzulande"]

title: "Fantaisie". This poem contains 12 lines
full_bibliographic_entry: "Fantaisie". This poem contains 12 lines [three stanzas] and Zweig's signature. The autographed leaf was sold at auction by the Dorotheum-Kunstabteilung, Wien, 14 October 1970. The present owner is unknown. The first line reads: "Mein Herz entstammt
clean_content:
"Fantaisie". This poem contains 12 lines [three stanzas] and Zweig's signature. The autographed leaf was sold at auction by the Dorotheum-Kunstabteilung, Wien, 14 October 1970. The present owner is unknown. The first line reads: "Mein Herz entstammt der Glut, aus Sonne ward mein Geist..."

'''French original:''' "Fantaisie" in ''La Lyre turque: Feux de paradise et roses d'enfer''. By Abdullah Cevdet [Djevdet]. Preface by Gustave Kahn. XI/1175p. Portrait of the poet. Wien: G. Frick Verlag, 1902, p. 99

''ÃŠtre autrichien. La problématique de la faute chez les écrivains autrichiens du début du siècle''. 376p. This is a "Thèse de doctorat (Littératures)" presented in 1995 to the Université Toulouse le Mirail - Toulouse II. The thesis compares the works of Hugo von Hofmannsthal, Stefan Zweig, Otto Weininger, Joseph Roth, Arthur Schnitzler, Karl Kraus, Hermann Broch, and Robert Musil

title: Jeffrey B. Berlin. "The Unpublished Correspondence between Albert Einstein and Stefan Zweig (with an unpublished Zweig Manifesto of 1933 and letters to Max Brod, Ben Huebsch, and Felix Salten)" in Brücken über dem Abgrund / Bridging the Abyss
full_bibliographic_entry: Jeffrey B. Berlin. "The Unpublished Correspondence between Albert Einstein and Stefan Zweig (with an unpublished Zweig Manifesto of 1933 and letters to Max Brod, Ben Huebsch, and Felix Salten)" in Brücken über dem Abgrund / Bridging the Abyss [1994],
publisher: Jeffrey B. Berlin. "The Unpublished Correspondence between Albert Einstein and Stefan Zweig (with an unpublished Zweig Manifesto of
clean_content:
Jeffrey B. Berlin. "The Unpublished Correspondence between Albert Einstein and Stefan Zweig (with an unpublished Zweig Manifesto of 1933 and letters to Max Brod, Ben Huebsch, and Felix Salten)" in Brücken über dem Abgrund / Bridging the Abyss [1994], pp. (337)-363. Contains 30 letters or excerpts: 

Stefan to Albert Einstein, 8 letters, 22 September 1920 - Undated 1936
Stefan Zweig + friends, two short greetings, 31 August 1920 [a telegram] and January 1932 [a note]
Albert Einstein to Stefan Zweig, 2 letters and a note, 10 November 1920, 18 October 1930, 28 June 1933
Stefan Zweig to Romain Rolland [about Einstein], 5 letters/excerpts, 17 February 1920 - 10 June 1933
Stefan Zweig to Ben Huebsch, 6 letters [excerpts about Einstein], 18 March 1933 - 8 June 1934
Elsa Einstein [Albert's second wife] to Stefan Zweig, 1 letter, 9 June 1933
Stefan Zweig to Elsa Einstein, 1 letter, 16 June 1933
Stefan Zweig to Felix Salten, 1 letter [references to Einstein], 7 May 1933
Stefan Zweig to Max Brod, 1 letter [references to Einstein], 9 May 1933
Friderike Maria Zweig to Albert Einstein, 1 letter, 26 November 1944
Albert Einstein to Friderike Maria Zweig, 1 letter, 3 December 1944

This is a collection of newspaper articl
clean_content:
'''[2014]: Edicions de la Ela Geminada, Girona'''

''El món de 1914'' [The World of 1914]. Edited and introduced by Antoni Martí Monterde. Translated by Marc Jiménez Buzzi. 1st edition. 108p. [Trivium, 6]

This is a collection of newspaper articles Stefan Zweig wrote during the first days of World War I.

The information on the dusk jacket reads (in Catalan):

"L'esforç de Stefan Zweig per assolir una comunitat d'esperit per sobre de les fronteres, un innegable talent com a memorialista d'uns temps difícils per a Europa i la seva activa militÃ ncia antibelÂ·licista han convertit la seva obra en un dels referents indiscutits del pacifisme. PerÃ² en els primers mesos de la Primera Guerra Mundial, Zweig no va mantenir exactament les actituds que ell mateix s'atribueix a les seves memÃ²ries, brillants i inqüestionables. Els articles reunits en El món de 1914 recuperen els escrits de guerra de Stefan Zweig publicats a la premsa per comentar, en temps real, els primers dies de la Guerra Gran. Expressions com ara Â«la voluntat de la raçaÂ», Â«aquella unitat suprema, forjada per la llengua, la raça, l'orgull i l'entusiasmeÂ» o bé Â«el soldat ha d'odiar amb tota la seva voluntat de viure una altra nacióÂ» ens mostren un Zweig belÂ·ligerant i militant, pro-germÃ nic i no gens pacifista. Indubtablement brillants, són peces d'orfebreria assagística i narrativa que posen al servei de la causa germÃ nica el seu estil inconfusible, tot i el seu contingut. Aquests articles permeten una completa revisió de la figura de Zweig, no per negar grandesa a la seva obra, sinó precisament per posar de manifest la complexitat de la seva identitat europea."

''Der Brief einer Unbekannten''. Edited with an introduction by Hanns Martin Elster. 20p. Portrait of Zweig. 54 leaves. Photocopy of the second draft of Zweig's manuscript, Salzburg, 18-27 September 1921. Contains a 2-page list of Zweig's works [Deutsche Dichterhandschriften, Vol. 13]

'''Contents:'''

Photograph of Stefan Zweig, p. (5)
Autobiographie des Dichters, pp. 7-10
Einleitung: Stefan Zweig [Hanns Martin Elster], pp. 10-20
Der Brief einer Unbekannten. 54 leaves
Verzeichnis der Werke von Stefan Zweig, pp. (76)-(77)
A deluxe edition of this work contains the following quatrain, signed by Zweig, printed on a sheet pasted on p. (2): "Die Schrift zeigt die Hand, / Das Wort den Verstand, / Doch nur im Werk wird das Wesen erkannt"


'''Reprint of the autobiography:'''

"Autobiographie des Dichters" in ''Baden-Badener Bühnenblat'' [Baden-Baden], 2:138/139 [25 November 1922], pp. 1-3; 2:140 [2 December 1922], pp. 2-3; 2:141 [9 December 1922], p.2
"Autobiographische Notiz" in Zweigheft 07 [2012], pp. 15-19, 21

The reviewer Māhir Shafīq Farīd quotes as outstanding witnesses of the influence Stefan Zweig's works had on Arab intellectuals two Egyptian thinkers: '''[1]'''. the philosopher 'Abdurrahmān Badawi [Ê¿Abd al-Raḥmān Badawī] (1917-2002), who testified to Zweig's greatness in the chapter "Ê¿Abqarī yantaḥir" [A Genius Committing Suicide] of his book ''Al-Mawt wa'l-Ê¿abqariyyah'' [Death and Genius]. Cairo: Maktabat al-Nahá¸ah al-Miṣriyyah, 2nd edition, 1962, pp. 80-96. See:

and '''[2]'''. the writer Yaḥyā á¸¤aqqī (1905-1992), who praised Zweig in the preface "Muqaddimah" to his translation ''Qiṣṣatān min al-adab al-almānī'' [Two Stories from German Literature]: Stefan Zweig's "Schachnovelle" [LāÊ¿ib al-shaṭranj] and Thomas Mann's "Tonio Krüger" [á¹¬ūniyū Krūjir]. ''Fragment einer Novelle''. Edited by Erich Fitzbauer. 4 lithographs by Hans Fronius. 27p. [Sonderpublikation der Internationalen Stefan-Zweig-Gesellschaft, 2. 500 numbered copies]. This is an excerpt from the story "Widerstand der Wirklichkeit". See below

'''Reprinted in:'''

''Das Buch des Gesamtverbandes schaffender Künstler Österreichs''. Wien: Verlag des Gesamtverbandes schaffender Künstler Österreichs, (1929), pp. 131-137
Das Stefan Zweig Buch [Frankfurt am Main, 1981], No. 9, pp. 172-(178)


'''Widerstand der Wirklichkeit'''

The complete work, entitled "Widerstand der Wirklichkeit", is located in the Stefan Zweig Archives, London. It consists of 41 numbered typed pages with handwritten corrections by Zweig. On the title page Stefan Zweig had also written a possible subtitle, "Die Reise in die Vergangenheit", which he then crossed out. 

'''Printed in:'''

Brennendes Geheimnis. Erzählungen [Frankfurt am Main, 1987], No. 6, pp. 221-(271)
Praterfrühling. Erzählungen [Frankfurt am Main, 1990], No. 6, pp. 221-(271) [Fischer Taschenbuch, 9242]

clean_content:
Stefan Zweig, 1881-1942. Ausstellung in der Residenz in Salzburg, 15. Juli bis 31. August 1961 [Wien, 1961], No. 11, p. 37, 1 letter, Stefan Zweig to Karl Emil Franzos, 18 February 1898. "Der österreichische Schriftsteller Karl Emil Franzos (1848-1904) redigierte in Berlin die Zeitschrift ''Deutsche Dichtung'', in der der sechzehnjährige Gymnasiast Stefan Zweig seine Gedichte veröffentlichen möchte. Er bietet Franzos auch Autographen an, die er nicht benötigt, und ersucht zugleich ein Manuskript von Franzos für seine Sammlung".

"Sunanda Mahajan. Co-founder and Editor of Kelyane Bhasantar" in ''BITS and Pieces: Get Global. Get Ahead'' [Pune], 2019. This is an interview with and a presentation of the Marathi literary translator Sunanda Mahajan, who is co-founder and editor of the Marathi tri-monthly magazine "Kelyane Bhasantar", dedicated to literary translation into Marathi. Mahajan states that "Schachnovelle", "Bud'dhibalācī gÅṣṭa" in Marathi, was one of her favorite translation projects.

title:
Kungliga Biblioteket - Sveriges Nationalbiblioteket, Stockholm. Hultenberg Archive. 2 volumes. Shelf number Acc. 2011/3. Five letters and one postcard from Stefan Zweig to Hugo Hultenberg

'''Letters:'''

16 June 1936. 1 page. Written in German
30 October 1936. 2 pages. Written in German
23 November 1936. 1 page. Written in German
5 January 1938. 1 page. Written in German
17 January 1940. 1 page. Written in English


'''Postcard:'''

One undated postcard with two printed poems: "Rio, ano novo 1941". Last line: Camões ''Os Luíadas'' and "Weh, wieviel Not und Fährnis auf dem Meere", Stefan Zweig's translation of "No mar tanta tormenta, e tanto dano...", the first canto of Luís Vaz de Camões' ''Os Lusíadas''

NB: Stefan Zweig's Algerian translator,
clean_content:
'''[1976]: al-Sharikah al-Waṭanīyah li-l-Nashr wa'l-Tawzī, al-Jazā'ir [Algiers]'''

''Al-Hurūb ilā 'llāh'' [Die Flucht zu Gott]. Translated by Abū 'l-'čªd Dūdū [Abou El Aid Doudou]. 69p. Reprinted 1979

NB: Stefan Zweig's Algerian translator, the late writer Abū 'l-'čªd Dūdū [Abou El Aid Doudou. 31 January 1934-15 January 2004], a professor of comparative literature at the University of Algiers, was the translator of many Austrian authors. In addition to Stefan Zweig, other famous names like Arthur Schnitzler and Franz Kafka were among them. His Arabic translations of "Brennendes Geheimnis" and "Die Mondscheingasse" remained manuscripts. A special web page is dedicated to Prof. Doudou's life and work. See: http://www.bdoudou.net/

title: "Il progjet Grande Vuere. In publicazion il librut plurilengâl sul 1914"
original_title: The Great War Project. Forthcoming: the Multilingual Book about 1914
full_bibliographic_entry: "Il progjet Grande Vuere. In publicazion il librut plurilengâl sul 1914" [The Great War Project. Forthcoming: the Multilingual Book about 1914] in ''Voce isontina : settimanale dell'arcidiocesi di Gorizia'' [The Voice of the Isonzo: Weekly of the Arc
publisher: "Il progjet Grande Vuere. In publicazion il librut plurilengâl sul
clean_content:
"Il progjet Grande Vuere. In publicazion il librut plurilengâl sul 1914" [The Great War Project. Forthcoming: the Multilingual Book about 1914] in ''Voce isontina : settimanale dell'arcidiocesi di Gorizia'' [The Voice of the Isonzo: Weekly of the Archdiocese of Gorizia] [Gorizia], Vol. 51, No. 11 [21 March 2015], p. 13

Although the announced research project "Grande Vuere" [Great War] deals with World War I and its consequences for the Italian province of Friuli Venezia Giulia and, therefore, it might in a strict sense not be counted under secondary literature about Stefan Zweig and his oeuvre, nevertheless, the motto of the project is a quotation taken from the ''Die Welt von Gestern. Erinnerungen eines Europäers'' and rendered into the Friulian language, thereby documenting the moral weight and cultural impact Stefan Zweig's autobiography wields in the assessment of World War I on a global level in a multitude of language communities, in this case the Friulian-speaking region Friuli Venezia Giulia of north-eastern Italy

Published online:

http://www.arlef.it/download/stampe-par-furlan/voce_isontina_21_03_2015_.pdf

http://www.voceisontina.eu/content/download/87464%2F1984965%2Ffile/15-11-2103.pdf

title: "Il y aurait une statistique surprenante..."
full_bibliographic_entry: "Il y aurait une statistique surprenante..." [Es gäbe eine überraschende Statistik...] in Stefan Zweig. L'Esprit européen en exil [Paris, 2020], No. 14, pp. (133)-137\n\nThis was a lecture by Stefan Zweig delivered at a conference in Lugano, Italy, i
publisher: ...Stefan Zweig présente le Tessin comme le microcosme dans lequel l'utopie de
clean_content:
"Il y aurait une statistique surprenante..." [Es gäbe eine überraschende Statistik...] in Stefan Zweig. L'Esprit européen en exil [Paris, 2020], No. 14, pp. (133)-137

This was a lecture by Stefan Zweig delivered at a conference in Lugano, Italy, in September 1934. A four-page typescript is located in the Stefan Zweig Collection in the State University of New York in Fredonia

Page (133): "...Stefan Zweig présente le Tessin comme le microcosme dans lequel l'utopie de "l'unité spirituelle de l'Europe" est devenue concrète: la rencontre des trois cultures italienne, française et allemande lui semble parfaitement réalisée. Le Tessin est dépeint par Stefan Zweig, qui compare Lugano Ã Genève au temps de Voltaire, Rousseau et Madame de StaÃ«l, comme un refuge accueillant pour les intellectuels exilés".

"Invité am Moies-Magazin - Dr. Klemens Renoldner iwwert de Stefan Zweig" [Invited to the Morning Magazine - Dr. Klemens Renoldner on Stefan Zweig] in ''Radio 100,7'' [Luxembourg City, Luxembourg], 11 January 2018, 10h30 - 10h45 AM

Published online (audio streaming):

https://www.100komma7.lu/program/episode/186253/20180111221500/7

This is a review of both, the German-French-Austrian movie "Vor der Morgenröte" (2016), directed by Maria Schrader, script by Maria Schrader and Jan Schomburg, and starring Josef Hader, Barbara Sukowa, and Aenne Schwarz, as well as the exposition "Ich gehöre nirgends mehr hin! Stefan Zweigs "Schachnovelle" - eine Geschichte aus dem Exil", which is shown in Luxembourg City in the cultural center Abtei NeimÃ«nster from 11 January to 8 April 2018

"Invité am Moies-Magazin

Dr. Klemens Renoldner iwwert de Stefan Zweig
11. Jan 2018 - 10:30

"Vor der Morgenröte" ass e Film iwwer d'Joren am Exil vum Stefan Zweig. Den Institut Pierre Werner weist dÃ«se Film a gläichzäiteg leeft och d'Ausstellung an der Abtei NeimÃ«nster zum selwechten Thema un. Den Dr. Klemens Renoldner schwätzt mam Valerija Berdi iwwer dÃ«s zwou Manifestatiounen an natierlech och iwwert de Stefan Zweig".

The last sentence in this quote reads: "Den Dr. Klemens Renoldner schwätzt mam Valerija Berdi iwwer dÃ«s zwou Manifestatiounen an natierlech och iwwert de Stefan Zweig". In English, this means: "Dr. Klemens Renoldner talks with Valerija Berdi about these two events and, of course, about Stefan Zweig, too".

Valerija Berdi must be the interviewer. She is probably a regular interviewer in the programme "Invité am Moies-Magazin" [Invited to the Morning Magazine], thus her name is not mentioned expressly in the second internet link <https://www.100komma7.lu/podcast/186253>

full_bibliographic_entry: '''[2012]: W. W. Norton, New York'''\n\n''Joseph Roth. A Life in Letters''. Translated and edited with an introduction by Michael Hofmann. 551/(7)p. Illustrated with 13 photographs between pp. 206-207. Frontispiece: Joseph Roth on a railway platform,
clean_content:
'''[2012]: W. W. Norton, New York'''

''Joseph Roth. A Life in Letters''. Translated and edited with an introduction by Michael Hofmann. 551/(7)p. Illustrated with 13 photographs between pp. 206-207. Frontispiece: Joseph Roth on a railway platform, somewhere in France, in 1925. This volume also contains dozens of letters from Joseph Roth to some 38 friends and acquaintances, especially Benno Reifenberg, his mother-in-law Jenny Reichler, Félix Bertaux, René Schickele, Carl Seelig, and some 52 letters to his French translator Blanche Gidon. See: Joseph Roth - Stefan Zweig. Briefwechsel 1927-1938

clean_content:
"Jupiter" [Contains one illustration by John Pike] in ''Collier's'' [Springfield, OH], 112:1 [3 July 1943], pp. 30, 66-68

Reprinted in:

[1]. ''Famous Dog Stories''. Edited by Page Cooper. Garden City, NY: Doubleday, 1948, pp. 180-198

[2]. ''Golden Book of Dog Stories''. Edited by Era Zistel. Chicago: Ziff-Davis, 1947, pp. 281-292

[3]. ''Selected Dog Stories''. Edited by Era Zistel. London: Hammond & Hammond, [ca. 1949], pp. 327-339. See F 16.


"Jupiter" [Retranslation into German by Ute Haffmans] in ''Die besten klassischen und modernen Hundegeschichten''. Zürich: Diogenes Verlag, 1973, pp. 355-372 [Diogenes-Hausbuch. Eine Diogenes Anthologie] 

Typescript version: The original typescript of 44 numbered pages with handwritten corrections by Zweig is located in Zweig's Nachlaß, London, and is entitled "War er es?"

Printed version: "War er es?" in ''Brennendes Geheimnis. Erzählungen''. Edited with an afterword by Knut Beck. Frankfurt am Main: S. Fischer Verlag, 1987, pp. 272-(312).

Translations: English, Estonian [F 301], Portuguese [A 80, 85, 111 / F 525], and Turkish [F 692]. See Eisenberg-Bach, Susi. [1]. "Unbekannter Stefan Zweig' and "Zwei unbekannte Novellen von Stefan Zweig"

Although the plot line is basically the same, there are two versions of this story with reference to the ending: The version entitled "Jupiter" [in English and in German] has a happy ending in which the dog, Jupiter, saves the child from the canal. On the other hand, the version entitled "War er es?" [or "Seria ele?" in Portuguese] has a sad ending in which the dog, Ponto, driven by envy and hatred, pushes the baby carriage into the canal

See also: [1]. Arthur Symons. "Die Schönheit spricht", p. 138. [2]. Emile Verhaeren. "Der Glöckner", pp. 40-43; "Die klagenden Lieder", p. 36; "Müdigkeit", p. 40; "Der Müller", pp. 37-40. '''English orginal:''' "Bright star, would that I were steadfast as thou art!"
 
The poems of John Keats have been reprinted countless times. The editions listed below are easily obtainiable:

''The Complete Poetical Works and Letters of John Keats'' [Cambridge Edition]. Boston/New York: Houghton Mifflin Company, 1899, p. 232
''Keats's Poetry and Prose''. Selected and edited by Jeffrey N. Cox. New York/London: W. W. Norton & Company, 2009, pp. 337-338. Contains a commentary on the sonnet and a holograph version thereof
''Life, Letters, and Literary Remains of John Keats''. Edited by Richard Monckton Milnes. Frontispiece portrait of John Keats. New York: George P. Putnam, 1848, p. 393. See also the British edition. 2 vols. London: E. Moxon, 1848
''The Poetical Works of Keats'' [Cambridge Edition]. Revised with a New Introduction by Paul D. Sheats. Boston: Houghton Mifflin Company, 1975, p. 232

title: \nAnsichtskarten von frühen Reisen
full_bibliographic_entry:
Ansichtskarten von frühen Reisen [Wien, 2000], No. 3, pp. (8)-(9), 1 postcard Stefan Zweig to Karl Klammer, 9 May 1901

Stefan Zweig, 1881-1942. Ausstellung in der Residenz in Salzburg, 15. Juli bis 31. August 1961 [Wien, 1961], '''No. 16, p. 38'
clean_content:
Ansichtskarten von frühen Reisen [Wien, 2000], No. 3, pp. (8)-(9), 1 postcard Stefan Zweig to Karl Klammer, 9 May 1901

Stefan Zweig, 1881-1942. Ausstellung in der Residenz in Salzburg, 15. Juli bis 31. August 1961 [Wien, 1961], '''No. 16, p. 38''', 1 handwritten letter from Stefan Zweig to Karl Klammer, 1902: "Zweig bat darin seinen "Gymnasialcollegen" Karl Klammer (1879-1959), von dessen Übersetzertatigkeit er erfahren hatte, ihn für seine Verlaine-Auswahl einige Übertragungen zur Verfugung zu stellen. Die persönliche Beziehung, die mit diesem Brief begann, wirkte sich nicht nur in gemeinsamer Tätigkeit aus, die 1907 in der Rimbaud-Ausgabe gipfelte, sie wurde auch zu einer herzlichen Freundschzaft. Klammer hat später seine Dichtungen unter dem Namen K. L. Ammer veröffentlicht, was Zweig (in einem Brief vom 1. Oktober 1906 an den Freund) als "ein sehr gelungenes Pseudonym" bezeichnet hat". '''No. 41, 42, 43 p. 44''', Stefan Zweig to Karl Klammer, 3 postcards, 20 November 1906, 2 January 1907, 30 January 1907

Stefan Zweig - Kapuzinerberg 5. Ein Salzburger Lesebuch [Salzburg, 1992], No. 3, p. (21), autograph copy of 1 postcard, Stefan Zweig to Karl Klammer, no date

clean_content:
'''[1995]: Bayerischer Schulbuchverlag, München'''

Klaus Langer & Sven Steinberg. "Die deutsche Literatur im Exil: Stefan Zweig" in ''Deutsche Dichtung. Literaturgeschichte in Beispielen für den Deutschunterricht'', pp. 286-291. This chapter contains biographical data about and an interpretation of Stefan Zweig's "Schachnnovelle". It also contains an excerpt from the novella as well as three photographs - one of Stefan Zweig [ca. 1924], one of Stefan and Lotte Zweig in Petropolis, and one of Curd Jürgens and Mario Adorf from 1960 film of "Schachnovelle"

Dr. B. and Czentovic, opposing personalities and values
The symbolism of chess
Futher reflection
Some questions to think about
Further reading

title: www.ekathimerini.com/248252/article/ekathimerini/whats-on/leporella-athens-january-11-26\n\n"Composer Giorgos Kouroupos turns Stefan Zweig's 1929 short story "Leporella" into an opus for the Greek National Opera's alternative stage at the Stavros Niarchos Foundation Cultural Center in southern Athens. The opera is in Greek and will be accompanied by English subtitles. "Leporella", set in early 20th century Vienna, tells the tale of a maid who works for an unhappy couple; the maid starts to develop feelings for her master and begins granting him favors that keep getting stranger. The story deals with human psychology in an unforgiving manner. Performances start at 8:30 p.m. (7:30 p.m. on Sundays)
full_bibliographic_entry: www.ekathimerini.com/248252/article/ekathimerini/whats-on/leporella-athens-january-11-26\n\n"Composer Giorgos Kouroupos turns Stefan Zweig's 1929 short story "Leporella" into an opus for the Greek National Opera's alternative stage at the Stavros Nia
clean_content:
www.ekathimerini.com/248252/article/ekathimerini/whats-on/leporella-athens-january-11-26

"Composer Giorgos Kouroupos turns Stefan Zweig's 1929 short story "Leporella" into an opus for the Greek National Opera's alternative stage at the Stavros Niarchos Foundation Cultural Center in southern Athens. The opera is in Greek and will be accompanied by English subtitles. "Leporella", set in early 20th century Vienna, tells the tale of a maid who works for an unhappy couple; the maid starts to develop feelings for her master and begins granting him favors that keep getting stranger. The story deals with human psychology in an unforgiving manner. Performances start at 8:30 p.m. (7:30 p.m. on Sundays). Ticket prices range from 15 to 20 euros. Fro more information and tickets, visit www.nationalopera.gr".

title: "Literatura i iskusstvo" in ''Novyi mir''
full_bibliographic_entry: "Literatura i iskusstvo" in ''Novyi mir'' [Moskva/Moscow], July 1930, pp. (175)-188. Stefan Zweig's response, pp. 184-185. The editorial staff of the ''Novyi mir'' sent out a letter to 15 authors asking for their opinion concerning the relationship b
clean_content: "Literatura i iskusstvo" in ''Novyi mir'' [Moskva/Moscow], July 1930, pp. (175)-188. Stefan Zweig's response, pp. 184-185. The editorial staff of the ''Novyi mir'' sent out a letter to 15 authors asking for their opinion concerning the relationship between artistic creations and political and social questions. In Stefan Zweig's response to the survey he said that recent Russian novels had more influence in Germany than newspaper reports concerning the current political and social realities of Russia. He also said that contributions from the older as well as the recent literature of Russia were highly respected and he suggested that Russian authors ought to visit Germany as long as possible and Germany authors should likewise visit Russia so as to unite the two countries.

This is a theater review of two plays, which were both staged in Paris in 2012-2013. The first play, "Piaf, une vie en rose et noir", written by Jacques Pessis and directed by Nathalie Lermitte, was staged at the Théâtre Daunou, starring Nathalie Lermitte, Jacques Pessis and Aurélien NoÃ«l. The second play, "Les derniers jours de Stefan Zweig", written by Laurent Seksik and directed by Gérard Gelas, was staged at the Théâtre Antoine, starring Patrick Timsit and Elsa Zylberstein

The posters for the performances of both plays are online:

[1]. http://www.billetreduc.com/97616/evt.htm

[2]. http://www.billetreduc.com/72998/evt.htm

full_bibliographic_entry: '''[1997]: Published by the Editor, St. Petersburg, Russia'''\n\n''Philosophie der Oberflächlichkeit 1928 (Casanova)''. Edited and illustrated by Ekaterina Michailowsky [Unikatbuch]. The volume consists of 17 leaves and 30 watercolor drawings and is
clean_content:
'''[1997]: Published by the Editor, St. Petersburg, Russia'''

''Philosophie der Oberflächlichkeit 1928 (Casanova)''. Edited and illustrated by Ekaterina Michailowsky [Unikatbuch]. The volume consists of 17 leaves and 30 watercolor drawings and is based on excerpts from ''Baumeister der Welt''. Leipzig: Insel Verlag, 1920-1928, Vol. 3 [1928] [Drei Dichter ihres Lebens: Casanova - Stendhal - Tolstoi], "Casanova", pp. (23)-122. 29 of the 30 drawings are based on excerpts from the Casanova essay.

'''See:''' http://www.buchkunst.info/moderne_buchkunst/buecher_land.php?land=RUS&off_set=30: "Von der Künstlerin datiert und signiert. Handschriftlicher Text in deutsch, Text und Bilder auf unbeschnittenem rotem Bütten, beidseitig bearbeitet. Vorsätze, Innen- und Außenseiten des Einbands bemalt. Das Buch enthält insgesamt vier Seiten bemalte Vorsätze, ein farbiges Titelblatt und 30 farbige Zeichnungen. Mit diesem wunderbaren, sehr freizügigen Werk setzt die Künstlerin die Tradition des russischen Jugendstils um 1900 fort".

'''[2002]: Dongfang Chubanshe, Beijing'''

''Mimi de shiqing: Licha Shitelaosi yu Sidifen Ciweige laiwang shuxin 1931-1935'' [Confidential Matters: The Correspondence between Richard Strauss and Stefan Zweig, 1931-1935]. Translated by Xiaosong Pan. Foreword by Aidehua E. Luowensiji. 142/(2)p. Translated from the English version: ''A Confidential Matter: The Letters of Richard Strauss and Stefan Zweig''. Translated by Max Knight. Foreword by Edward E. Lowinsky. xxxi/122p. Illustrated. Berkeley/Los Angeles/London: University of California Press, 1977

Qianyan [Foreword by Aidehua E. Luowensji], pp. 1-23
Shitelaosi yu Ciweige laiwang shuxin [Strauss/Zweig Correspondnce], pp. 1-136. Zweig to Strauss, 50 letters, 10 postcards, 29 October 1931 - December 1935. Strauss to Zweig, 63 letters, 3 postcards, 2 telegrams, 31 October 1931 - 31 October 1935. Friderike Maria Zweig to Strauss, 1 letter, 5 April 1933. Strauss to Friderike Maria Zweig, 1 letter, 9 February 1935
Yingyizhe houji [Endnotes from the English edition], pp. 137-141
Yi houji [Endnotes by Xiaosong Pan], pp. 142-(144)

clean_content:
"Brief von Gabriela Mistral an Eduardo Mallea" [Translated from Spanish into German by Erich Hackl] in Zweigheft / zweigheft 10 [Salzburg, 2013], No. 3, pp. 12-19

'''Reprinted in:'''

Stefan Zweig - Abschied von Europa [Wien, 2014], No. 25, pp. 284-287

This is a letter from the Chilean poetess [and Nobel prize winner for literature in 1945] and the directress of the Chilean consulate in Rio de Janeiro to Eduardo Mallea, the editor of the literary supplement of the daily newspaper ''La Nación'' in Buenos Aires. Mistral's letter was printed in ''La Nación'' on 3 March 1942

Republished by the translator of this review in his personal blog:

''Al-Manfā'' [The Exile]. Translated by Aḥmad al-ShāfiÊ¿ī [Ahmed Shafie] in ''QirāÊ¾čt Aḥmad al-ShāfiÊ¿ī'' [Ahmed Shafie's Reviews] [Egypt], 16 May 2015. "QirāÊ¾čt Aḥmad al-ShāfiÊ¿ī" [Ahmed Shafie's Reviews] is a blog by the Egyptian poet, novelist and translator Aḥmad al-ShāfiÊ¿ī [Ahmed Shafie]

Published online:

http://readingtuesday.blogspot.de/2014/05/blog-post_16.html

This is a partial translation of Anka Muhlstein's review "His Exile Was Intolerable". [Translated from the French by Antony Shugaar] in ''The New York Review of Books'' [New York], LXI:9 [8 May 2014], pp. 13-15. 

See: 

<http://www.nybooks.com/articles/2014/05/08/stefan-zweig-exile-was-intolerable/>, 

<http://www.nybooks.com/articles/2014/05/08/stefan-zweig-exile-was-intolerable/?printpage=true>

While Anka Muhlstein's original review covers George Prochnik's biography ''The Impossible Exile: Stefan Zweig at the End of the World'' [New York: Other Press, 2014] as well as Wes Anderson's film ''The Grand Budapest Hotel'', the Arabic translator jumps over the latter part. This is therefore merely a review of:

George Prochnik's ''The Impossible Exile: Stefan Zweig at the End of the World''

title: Nikol'skaia, T. "Stefan Zweig glasami Grigola Robakidze. Primechanie k teme" in ''Rossia i Zapad. Sbornik v chest' K. M. Azadovskogo''. Compiled by M. Besrodnyi et al. 635p. Moskva: Novoe literaturnoe obozrenie, 2011, pp. 341-344
full_bibliographic_entry: Nikol'skaia, T. "Stefan Zweig glasami Grigola Robakidze. Primechanie k teme" in ''Rossia i Zapad. Sbornik v chest' K. M. Azadovskogo''. Compiled by M. Besrodnyi et al. 635p. Moskva: Novoe literaturnoe obozrenie, 2011, pp. 341-344 [Nauchnaya bibliotek
clean_content: Nikol'skaia, T. "Stefan Zweig glasami Grigola Robakidze. Primechanie k teme" in ''Rossia i Zapad. Sbornik v chest' K. M. Azadovskogo''. Compiled by M. Besrodnyi et al. 635p. Moskva: Novoe literaturnoe obozrenie, 2011, pp. 341-344 [Nauchnaya biblioteka]. This is an account of the private meeting of Stefan Zweig and Grigol Robakidze in Moscow in 1928 during the 100th anniversary celebration of the birth of Leo Tolstoi. The passage from Grigol Robakidze's essay "Dni Tolstogo", written as a diary and his entry in this diary dated 13 September 1928, are included in this article.

title: ''The Beauty and Meaning of Autographs''
full_bibliographic_entry: ''The Beauty and Meaning of Autographs''. A dramatic theater performance. Directed and produced by James Robinson. Theatrical group: Deep Dark South. Performed in the Space on the Mile@The Radisson, 80 High Street, Edinburgh, Scotland, during the Edi
publisher: ''The Beauty and Meaning of Autographs''. A dramatic theater performance. Directed and produced by James Robinson. Theatrical group: Deep Dark South. Performed in the Space on the Mile@The Radisson
clean_content: ''The Beauty and Meaning of Autographs''. A dramatic theater performance. Directed and produced by James Robinson. Theatrical group: Deep Dark South. Performed in the Space on the Mile@The Radisson, 80 High Street, Edinburgh, Scotland, during the Edinburgh Festival Fringe. Length 1 hour and 15 minutes. Performed 6-14 August 2010. "In the 1920s and 30s, Stefan Zweig was the most translated writer in the world. His stories such as 'Letter from an Unknown Woman' and 'Beware of Pity' blended masterly storytelling, psychological truth and an understanding of the dark, hidden emotions beneath everyday life. By 1942 Zweig was dead, another Jewish casualty of the Nazi regime and a victim of his own destructive impluses. Blurring fact and fiction in a riveting, moving production, mixing theatricality, music and innovative projection, Deep Dark South's new play explores the life and work of a forgotten master. . . based on letters between Stefan and his wife Friderike Maria Zweig, as well as his short stories and his autobiography 'The World of Yesterday'". See: edfringe.com/.../beauty-and-meaning-o...\n\n

Contains a discussion of George Prochnik's new biography of Stefan Zweig, ''The Impossible Exile. Stefan Zweig at the End of the World'', and Wes Anderson's film ''The Grand Budapest Hotel''. Mention is also made of the brilliant English translations of Zweig's works by Anthea Bell, Laurent Seksik's recent novel ''The Last Days'' [''Les Derniers Jours de Stefan Zweig''] which is an account of Zweig's final six months, and there are also quotations from an interview with the Brazilian writer Alberto Dines. Illustrated with a photograph of Stefan Zweig and one of Ralph Fiennes [who looks like Stefan Zweig] in ''The Grand Budapest Hotel'', which is set in Europe between the wars, the milieu of much of Stefan Zweig's work

'''Portuguese translation:'''

"O romancista austríaco Stefan Zweig volta a brilhar" [Translated from English into Brazilian Portuguese by Paulo Migliacci] in ''Folha de S. Paulo'' [São Paulo], 22 June 2014

Published online:

https://www1.folha.uol.com.br/ilustrissima/2014/06/1473569-o-romancista-austriaco-stefan-zweig-volta-a-brilhar.shtml

"The Visionary Art of William Blake" in ''Edinburgh Review'' [London], 203:415 [January/April 1906], pp. 161-179

full_bibliographic_entry: Die Salzburger Stefan Zweig Poetikvorlesung bei Sonderzahl:\n\n'''Band 1''': Ilma Rakuša. ''Autobiographisches Schreiben als Bildungsroman''. 79/(1)p. Wien: Sonderzahl Verlagsgesellschaft, 2014: "Im Triestiner Siesta-Zimmer ortete ich die Geburtsstun
publisher: Im Triestiner Siesta-Zimmer ortete ich die Geburtsstunde der Schriftstellerin, den Akt, eine Parallelwelt zu schaffen, was sich als lebensnotwendig erwie
clean_content:
Die Salzburger Stefan Zweig Poetikvorlesung bei Sonderzahl:

'''Band 1''': Ilma Rakuša. ''Autobiographisches Schreiben als Bildungsroman''. 79/(1)p. Wien: Sonderzahl Verlagsgesellschaft, 2014: "Im Triestiner Siesta-Zimmer ortete ich die Geburtsstunde der Schriftstellerin, den Akt, eine Parallelwelt zu schaffen, was sich als lebensnotwendig erwie"

'''Band 2''': Feridun Zaimoglu. ''Selbstverschwendung (in drei Bildern)''. 67/(1)p. Wien: Sonderzahl Verlagsgesellschaft, 2014: "... bei jedem Buch fahre ich in die Haut der Hauptfigut ..."

'''Band 3''': Terézia Mora. ''Der geheime Text''. 112p. Wien: Sonderzahl Verlagsgesellschaft, 2016: "Das Gegenteil des sprachlosen Lebens war (für mich): zu schreiben"

'''Band 4''': Michael Stavariā. ''Der Autor als Sprachwanderer''. 165/(1)p. Wien: Sonderzahl Verlagsgesellschaft, 2016: "Seiner Heimat den Rücken zu kehren (ganz gleich aus welchen Gründen) führt zu dem Punkt, die Welt sprachlich neu zu erfassen"

'''Band 5''': Ann Cotten. ''Was geht''. 174/(1)p. Wien: Sonderzahl Verlagsgesellschaft, 2018: "Spazieren ist Mnemotechnik und Schicksal, weil: die Identität ist das, was man sich vormemoriert. Und die Einübung der Flucht zementiert das Schicksal, wie wir aus der Literatur wissen"

clean_content:
"Selig, die selber nicht ernten wollen ..." in ''Herrn Rudolf Mosse überreicht die Redaktion zum 70. Geburtstag, 8. Mai 1913, diese Grüße seiner Freunde und Mitarbeiter''. Berlin: [Privatdruc]k], 1913, p. 90

The first stanze is reprinted in: Karl Gladt. ''StammbÅ©cher aus Wien''. [Wien/München: Verlag Jugend & Volk, 1967, p. 61 [A facsimile of the handwritten version is printed on p. 73]

The manuscript version is located in the Mosse-Album / Deutsche Staatsbibliothek, Berlin, Alba amicorum 141. leaf 129v

An autograph copy of the first stanza is located in the Handschriftenabteilung, Stadtbibliothek München under the title "Widmungsgedicht an Marie Eugenie delle Grazie". The ''Stammbuch Marie Eugenie delle Grazie'', from which this poem is taken, is located in the Wiener Stadtbibliothek under the number Ic 118.828. Three manuscript copies of this poem exist - the first stanza in Wien and München, the entire poem in Berlin

location: Each of the actors reported the fate of the main character in the first person
clean_content:
'''[2010]: Cumberlandsche Bühne, Staatstheater, Hannover'''

''Sternstunden der Menschheit''. A theatrical adaptation by Soeren Voima. Stage direction by Christian Tschirner. Scenery by Aljoscha Begrich. Costumes by Esther Krapiwnikow. Music by Martin Vischer.

Each of the actors reported the fate of the main character in the first person:

Susana Fernandes Genebra [Cicero]
Janko Kahle [Lenin / Der versiegelte Zug]
Christoph Müller [Johann August Suter / Die Entdeckung Eldorados]
Oscar Olivo [Dostojewski / Heroischer Augenblick]
Julia Schmalbrock [Robert Falcan Scott / Der Kampf um den Südpol]
Martin Vischer [Die Eroberung von Byzanz]


'''Premiere:'''

8 May 2010 in the Cumberlandsche Bühne, Staatstheater, Hannover. The play was repeated on 14 and 23 May as well as on 3, 15, 20 and 24 June

'''Review:'''

Ronald Meyer-Arlt. "Spiel: Geschichte. Stefan Zweigs 'Sternstunden der Menschheit' auf der Cumberlandschen Bühne uraufgeführt" in ''Hannoversche Allgemeine Zeitung'' [Hannover], 10 May 2010. The review contains a photograph of Susana Fernandes Genebra and the four male actors but for some reason Julia Schmalbrock was omitted

title: The Stols-Archives of the Bibliotheek Zuid-Kennemerland, Haarlem, Holldand contain 22 letters pertaining to Stefan Zweig:\n\nHerbert Reichner
full_bibliographic_entry: The Stols-Archives of the Bibliotheek Zuid-Kennemerland, Haarlem, Holldand contain 22 letters pertaining to Stefan Zweig:\n\nHerbert Reichner [Herbert Reichner Verlag, Wien] to the publisher A. A. M. Stols, 8 December 1932. Concerning a typographical
clean_content:
The Stols-Archives of the Bibliotheek Zuid-Kennemerland, Haarlem, Holldand contain 22 letters pertaining to Stefan Zweig:

Herbert Reichner [Herbert Reichner Verlag, Wien] to the publisher A. A. M. Stols, 8 December 1932. Concerning a typographical printing of Zweig's novella "Die unsichtbare Sammlung" to be added as a supplement to ''Philobiblon. Eine Zeitschrift für Bücherliebhaber'' [Reichner Verlag, Wien]. A revised version of this story did indeed appear as a 15-page supplement to the ''Philobiblon'' [Wien], 6:9 [November 1933]. The original version of "Die unsichtbare Sammlung" appeared in the ''Neue Freie Press'' [Wien], 31 May 1925, pp. 2-7
Stefan Zweig to A. A. M. Stols, 13 letters, 20 April 1933-28 October 1937. Two of these letters were sent by Zweig's secretary [28 April 1933 and 23 October 1937]. There is also one telegram, 23 November 1934: "Sendet bucher nicht London sondern Salzburg. Zweig" 
A. A. M. Stols to Stefan Zweig, 6 letters, 24 May 1934-25 January 1938. There is also a letter from Stols to the Amsterdamsche Bank, 26 October 1937, requesting that 77.43 florins be sent to Zweig as a royalty payment for the sale of the Dutch translation of Zweig's ''Erasmus''
Friderike Maria Zweig to an unnamed recipient, 1 letter, 3 March 1959. The letter, written in French, is a thank you note for the recipient's willingness to send her copies of the Zweig letters in his possession. She also sent the recipient a copy of a letter by Erich Fitzbauer announcing the formation of the Stefan Zweig Gesellschaft, Wien VIII, Piaristengasse 46/17. Erich Fitzbauer was the president of the Stefan Zweig Gesellschaft, Friderike Maria Zweig was the honorary president of the society

"Bayt al-khayāl" [House of Fiction] is a webforum moderated by the Tunisian literary critic Kamāl al-Riyāḥī [Kamel Riahi]

Published online:

https://housefictionrk.wordpress.com/2016/01/06/%D8%B3%D8%AA%D9%8A%D9%81%D8%A7%D9%86-%D8%AA%D8%B3%D9%81%D8%A7%D9%8A%D8%AC-%D8%B1%D8%AC%D9%84-%D8%A8%D9%84%D8%A7-%D9%88%D8%B7%D9%86/

This slightly abridged and anonymously published review was originally written in English by A. O. Scott. "Man Without a Country. Today's Paper" in The New York Times [New York], 15 June 2014, pp. BR12.

See:

https://www.nytimes.com/2014/06/15/books/review/george-prochniks-impossible-exile-about-stefan-zweig.html>.

While Scott's review centers on George Prochnik's biography The Impossible Exile: Stefan Zweig at the End of the World [New York: Other Press, 2014], the Arab translator's omissions and manipulations make it actually seem to be a review of Oliver Matuschek's biography Stefan Zweig. Drei Leben - Eine Biographie [Frankfurt am Main: S. Fischer Verlag, 2006]

Ahmed Lotfy's blog "Wāḥat al-kutub" [The Books' Oasis] is dedicated to Arabic literature, fiction as well as science. Short curricula vitae introduce the authors and provide a list of their texts, either in the Arabic original or in Arabic translation. In the case of the above-mentioned CV of Stefan Zweig, short information is given for five of his books translated into Arabic

''Abjad'' [Abjjad / Alphabet] is an Arab online community, the company head quarters of which are based in Amman, Jordan. The members of the online community contribute short reviews and critiques of the books they read. One entry is dedicated to Stefan Zweig and his oeuvre under the afore-mentioned heading "Stīfān Zfāyj: 1881 tuwuffiya sanat 1942 al-Nimsā" [Stefan Zweig, 1881, died 1942, Austria]. Altogether [as of 8 December 2017] there are fourteen translations of Zweig's works into Arabic which are presented to the general reader

At first g
clean_content:
'''[2017]: Papyrus Publishing, Yogyakarta'''

''The Royal Game and Other Stories'' [Schachnovelle und andere Erzählungen]. Translated into Indonesian by Maria Vregina and Aprilia Rizqi Parwidanti. Edited by Wayan Darmaputra. (8)/226p.

At first glance, the English title of the book seems to indicate a mere Indonesian reedition of one of the English translations. Yet, the ads of the Indonesian booksellers classify the text as a translation ("terjemahan") <https://bukupocer.com/p/royal-game-stories/>, reporting even the names of the two Indonesian translators ("penerjemah"), Maria Vregina and Aprilia Rizqi Parwidanti <https://www.berdikaribook.red/the-royal-game-and-other-stories.html>. Moreover, they state expressly that the language ("bahasa") of the text is "Indonesia" <http://www.demabuku.com/papyrus-publishing.html/the-royal-game-and-other-stories.html>, which stands for "bahasa Indonesia", the official designation of the Indonesian language. Cf. as well:

https://www.google.de/search?q=%22The+Royal+Game+and+Other+Stories%22+Papyrus+Publishing&tbm=isch&source=iu&pf=m&ictx=1&fir=B2wRd1MDKw9vFM%253A%252CjeQ2TA33p-IQvM%252C_&usg=__XT7lvYdOPNkO-FvARLa-EU9e-FA%3D&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwi31oqLmunWAhWRZlAKHREyABkQ9QEIPjAD&biw=1400&bih=921#imgrc=B2wRd1MDKw9vFM:

'''[1967]: Hans Schneider Verlag, Tutzing'''

"Richard Strauss und seine Vaterstadt" in ''Festschrift Dr. Franz Strauss zum 70. Geburtstag'' [Tutzing, 1967], pp. (135)-149. P. 146: "Über Stefan Zweig und Joseph Gregor war Strauss auf den Gedanken gekommen, eine Oper ["Capriccio"] über die Oper ["Der Friedenstag"] zu schreiben". "Der Friedenstag" [1938] was based on an idea by Stefan Zweig and "Capriccio" [1942] was also based on ideas by Stefan Zweig in the 1930s

This is a screening announcement of the German-French-Austrian movie "Vor der Morgenröte" (2016), directed by Maria Schrader, script by Maria Schrader and Jan Schomburg, and starring Josef Hader, Barbara Sukowa, and Aenne Schwarz. The film was being screened (with Thai and English subtitles) on the 24th of January 2017 at 7:30 PM in a film festival organized by the Goethe-Institut Thailand, the local branch in Bangkok of the German Cultural Institute.

On 29 October 1940, in Buenos Aires, Stefan Zweig repeated his lecture "The Spiritual Unity of the World" that he had given in Rio de Janeiro in August 1936. This time the text was in Spanish. "Warnung an Bibliophilen" in ''National-Zeitung'' [Berlin], 4 March 1922 [No. 54], Beiblatt, p. 1. full_bibliographic_entry: '''[1961]: A. Holzhausens Nachfolger, Wien'''\n\nStefan Zweig, 1881-1942. Ausstellung in der Residenz in Salzburg, 15. Juli bis 31. August 1961, No. 53, p. 46: Brief Stefan Zweigs an den Direktor des Deutschen Volkstheaters in Wien [Adolf Weisse?], v
publisher: ...Sie hatten seinerzeit ein sehr freundliches Interesse für meinen Einakter ''Der verwandelte Comoediant'', den ich aber damals nicht einem Wiener Theater geben wollte, weil es mir peinlich gewesen wäre, mit einer solchen Bluette in Wien zu debütieren. Nun aber mein Eintrée durch die Annahme im Burgtheater (gemeint ist das Stuck ''Das Haus am Meer'') gesichert ist und der Einakter seine dramatische Probe in Breslau gut, sogar sehr gut, wie ich höre, bestanden hat, würde ich ihn gerne am D. V. haben...
clean_content:
'''[1961]: A. Holzhausens Nachfolger, Wien'''

Stefan Zweig, 1881-1942. Ausstellung in der Residenz in Salzburg, 15. Juli bis 31. August 1961, No. 53, p. 46: Brief Stefan Zweigs an den Direktor des Deutschen Volkstheaters in Wien [Adolf Weisse?], vom 10. Mai 1912 [Concerning Stefan Zweig's drama ''Der verwandelte Komödiant'']: "...Sie hatten seinerzeit ein sehr freundliches Interesse für meinen Einakter ''Der verwandelte Comoediant'', den ich aber damals nicht einem Wiener Theater geben wollte, weil es mir peinlich gewesen wäre, mit einer solchen Bluette in Wien zu debütieren. Nun aber mein Eintrée durch die Annahme im Burgtheater (gemeint ist das Stuck ''Das Haus am Meer'') gesichert ist und der Einakter seine dramatische Probe in Breslau gut, sogar sehr gut, wie ich höre, bestanden hat, würde ich ihn gerne am D. V. haben..."

The archives contain the original 6-page autograph version of Werfel's lecture and the 8-page typescript thereof. A copy, handwritten by Werfel, is also located the Friderike Maria Zweig Archives, Reed Library, State University of New York, Fredonia, NY 14063. The archives also contain one letter concerning Franz Werfel and three telegrams concerning his death

title: "Die Frage 'Whither Jewry' ist schwer zu beantworten...". The original manuscript contains 4 leaves and is obviously a fragment. It used to be in the Stefan Zweig Archives in London; now it is located in the archives of the Stefan Zweig Zentrum Salzburg. The German original is printed in "Worte haben keine Macht mehr"
full_bibliographic_entry: "Die Frage 'Whither Jewry' ist schwer zu beantworten...". The original manuscript contains 4 leaves and is obviously a fragment. It used to be in the Stefan Zweig Archives in London; now it is located in the archives of the Stefan Zweig Zentrum Salzb
publisher: What will happen to the Jews? [A letter by Stefan Zweig to Joseph Leftwich, 23 April 1936] in
clean_content:
"Die Frage 'Whither Jewry' ist schwer zu beantworten...". The original manuscript contains 4 leaves and is obviously a fragment. It used to be in the Stefan Zweig Archives in London; now it is located in the archives of the Stefan Zweig Zentrum Salzburg. The German original is printed in "Worte haben keine Macht mehr" [Wien, 2019], No. 26, pp. 152-154. Commentaries, p. 262. 

'''English translation:'''

"Whither Jewry?" is an address prepared for a symposium sponsored by the Yiddish periodical ''Dos Yiddishe Vort'' in London in 1935. This address was translated into English by Joseph Leftwish, who also read it for Stefan Zweig at the symposium

A fragment of the Joseph Leftwich translation is included on pp. 93-94 in his article "Stefan Zweig and the World of Yesterday" in ''Year Book'' [Leo Baeck Institute, London], III [1958], pp. 81-100

See also: "What will happen to the Jews? [A letter by Stefan Zweig to Joseph Leftwich, 23 April 1936] in "Worte haben keine Macht mehr" [Wien, 2019], No. 28, pp. 161-163. German version: "Was wird mit Juden geschehen?", No. 47, pp. 239-241

'''French translation:''' "OÃ¹ va le judaÃ¯sme?" in Stefan Zweig. L'Esprit européen en exil [Paris, 2020], No. 12, pp. (121)-125. Translated into French by Jacques Le Rider

"Was ist Sparsamkeit?" A lecture delivered on 24 September 1912 in the Vienna Urania. The Urania is a public educational institute and observatory. It was opened in 1910. It was severely damaged during World War II and, after it was reconstructed, it was reopened in 1957

title: "Battānah Niyūz - jadīd Dār al-Khān.. thalāth tarjamāt li-Amānī Lāzār"

full_bibliographic_entry: "Battānah Niyūz - jadīd Dār al-Khān.. thalāth tarjamāt li-Amānī Lāzār" [Battana News - New Publications by Dār al-Khān: Three Translations by Amānī Lāzār], in: Battānah [Battana] [Kafr El Sheikh, Egypt], 17 October 2017\n\nPublished onl
publisher: a newcomer in the Arabic publishing field, the Kuwaiti publishing house DÄr al-KhÄn:\n\n[1]
clean_content:
"Battānah Niyūz - jadīd Dār al-Khān.. thalāth tarjamāt li-Amānī Lāzār" [Battana News - New Publications by Dār al-Khān: Three Translations by Amānī Lāzār], in: Battānah [Battana] [Kafr El Sheikh, Egypt], 17 October 2017

Published online:

http://www.battana.org/news-details.aspx?Q=30764&C=1

This is an announcement of the recent translation of two of Stefan Zweig's novellas, "Brief einer Unbekannten" and "Phantastische Nacht", by the Syrian translator Amānī Lāzār. The translation of "Brief einer Unbekannten" is the latest of several Arabic retranslations this novella has seen during the last decades. Both translations are published by a newcomer in the Arabic publishing field, the Kuwaiti publishing house Dār al-Khān:

[1]. "Risālah min imraÊ¾ah majhūlah" [Brief einer Unbekannten]. Translated by Amānī Lāzār. Edited by Muḥammad Sālim. Kuwait: Dār al-Khān li-l-Tarjamah wa'l-Nashr, 2017

[2]. "Laylah sāḥirah" [Phantastische Nacht. Erzählungen]. Translated by Amānī Lāzār. Edited by Muḥammad Sālim. Kuwait: Dār al-Khān li-l-Tarjamah wa'l-Nashr, 2017

"Kamā law anna bika jūÊ¿an li-ltihām al-bashar" [As If There Were a Hunger in You to Devour Human Beings!] in ''Bānūrāmā : nāfidhatuka Ê¿alā Ê¾l-Ê¿člam'' [Panorama Newspaper. Your Window to the World] [Baghdad / Parramatta, NSW, Australia], Vol. 8, No. ? [2 December 2015], pp. ??

The Iraqi daily ''Bānūrāmā'' [Panorama] is published by Widād Farḥčn

Starting with a long quote from Castellio, the reviewer compares the "medieval" religious intolerance of Calvin's Geneva and the Inquisition with the same kind of fanaticism practised by Al-Qaeda and their ilk in present-day Muslim countries. Muslims, and especially the Arabs among them, should follow the example of the Christians and "liberate their religion from this criminal way of denouncing others as heretics"

Published online:

clean_content:
'''[1919]: Roland-Verlag, München'''

''Gelandet. Ein dramatisches Gedicht, 1916-1917''. 45p. [Die Neue Reihe des Roland-Verlages, Vol. 13]. In honor of his friend Paul Zech, Zweig wrote the following: "Wie Stahl, wie Metall behandelt Zech die Sprache. Man spürt den Menschen hinter dem wirklich imposanten Künstler und Gestalter gleichsam bloß als Krafterreger". These few words of appreciation are printed on the front cover of Zech's ''Gelandet. Ein dramatisches Gedicht, 1916-1917''


'''[1943]: Quadriga Verlag, Buenos Aires'''

''Stefan Zweig. Eine Gedenk-Schrift''. 43/(4)p. Frontispiece: a photograph of Stefan Zweig. Page 43 contains Stefan Zweig's last poem, "Linder schwebt der Stunden Reigen..." [Rio de Janeiro, 4 February 1942]. 300 numbered copies were printed
